column4: how do i renew my LAN connection?  I didn't do the autoconfigure during the install of ubuntu server
sorry, missed it. it should be
- it says dhcpcd is not a command
you may have to install the package. reboot possibly?
or unplug the cord, plug it back in. eth0 may also be down. you could try sudo ifconfig eth0 up
- sorry, one more thing, how do i get dhcpcd from the install cd??
you may have to use the filesystem if you know it. sudo mount -t <Filesystem> /dev/cdrom /media/cdrom
and when typign...tab is your friend

whenever typing in the terminal, you can type a few letters then hit tab, and it will finish the rest for you. for example, i run wow from the terminal...but it would take a good 3 minutes to type everything with the escape characters. i can type "Wo [tab]" and it will finish the rest for me. using tab in the terminal cuts your time, its just a shortcut
- i'm not connected to the internet, but even when I mount the cdrom at /media/cdrom apt-get does not find the dhcpcd package
it will have to be installed from a cd, or from a thumb drive if you have one
